intro: Mastigostyla boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian spiny tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, spiny leaves, and showy, pink to red flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forests and savannas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal uses.
